Message.Title: Korean & Japanese INVENTIONS in Computers and Electronics and Audio/Video
Message.Msg: This would be a real short book, like "French Military Victories". KEY INVENTIONS IN COMPUTER TECH., ELECTRONICS, AUDIO & VIDEO TECH: Recording of Sound: Thomas Edison, Records (the original discs and cylindrical recordings) 1880s? Magnetic Recording of Sound: Magnetic Tape, Germany 1930s. Radio: Marconi 1898, Italian Inventor. Movies: Edison 1890s. Electronic Vacuum Tube: Lee Deforest, American 1906 FM: Frequency Modulation for higher quality sound and video transmission (Used in TV too) Armstrong, American in 1930s and 1940s. First Electronic Computers: Sperry Univac Corp. Vacuum Tube run computers, paid for by US Military in WWII, and England also made their own. Transistor and Semi-Conductors to replace Vacuum Tubes, Bell Labs 1948, Dr. Shockley USA. Laser (makes possible DVD and CD Drives, and high speed internet data transmitted over optical fibers) Bell Labs, USA 1960. Microprocessor, Intel 1974, USA. Integrated Circuits, Fairchild Semiconductor, Long Island USA 1968 (precursor to Microprocessor) CDs and DVDs, RCA Labs the Video-Disc mid to late 1970s, USA. Personal Computers: Altair and Apple and Commdore Computer, all USA mid-to-late 1970s. Stereo and High Fidelity Electronics: Fisher, HH Scott, McIntosh, Harman Kardon, 1950s and 1960s all made in USA back then. Internet, US Govern. funded developement of in late 1960s? THE KOREANS AND JAPANESE NEVER DEVELOPED ANY ORIGINAL TECHNOLOGY. ALL THEY EVER BROUGHT TO THE TABLE WAS UNDER-VALUED CURRENCY, AND WILLING LOW-COST FACTORY WORKER POPULATION USA LACKS THANKS TO WELFARE PROGRAMS.

The street knows that the verdict didnt effect Google.. and infact very well could have helped them... a 9.5 point drop could have occured anyday.... therefore the verdict meant nothing against Google.... now if the verdict gets overturned... Google will explode. Which could very well happen seeing how the Jury came to their conclusions... they didnt even give enough time to read through all the proper paperwork... the verdict seems to be out of vindication... rather than reasoning... this verdict could very well be turned over by the judge.

Message.Title: Google Releases Statement on Samsung Vs. Apple, Says the Patents Involved Don’t Relate to Core Android
Message.Msg: Google Releases Statement on Samsung Vs. Apple, Says the Patents Involved Don’t Relate to Core Android We have all had a few days to read and react to the verdict that was handed down last Friday against Samsung in the trial against Apple. It was a landslide victory for Apple and a huge loss for Samsung (pending appeals, of course), but Google has released a memo over the weekend saying that this ruling doesn’t necessarily mean a loss for Android. Most of these don’t relate to the core Android operating system, and several are being re-examined by the US Patent Office. The mobile industry is moving fast and all players – including newcomers – are building upon ideas that have been around for decades. We work with our partners to give consumers innovative and affordable products, and we don’t want anything to limit that. Google is correct in this statement, saying that the verdict was an indictment of Samsung as a company, not Android as a whole. Still, it’s a little disconcerting to see Google release a statement so non-supportive of their biggest Android OEM. Then again, they did tell Samsung that their designs looked too much like Apple’s and recommended that they change them. Do you want to see Google fighting for their Android OEMs more or do you think they’re doing all they can?
